paper_abstract: The globally tracking problem of linear differential inclusion systems with disturbances is studied in this article. By using the Hamilton-Caylay Theorem, an operator is constructed such that tracking problem is converted into a standard stabilisation problem. A control law is designed such that the output signal of the closed-loop system tracks some reference signal and rejects the disturbances. A second-order LDI system is used to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed design technique.
paper_title: Output tracking and disturbance rejection of linear differential inclusion systems
